thread.title: CHS Swimming: Pirates fall to Spuds in rare dual loss this season
thread.title_full: CHS Swimming: Pirates fall to Spuds in rare dual loss this season

author: Jim Turvey
title: CHS Swimming: Pirates fall to Spuds in rare dual loss this season
text: Follow @@CroxTimesSports Posted Oct. 23, 2015 at 9:34 AM The Pirate swim team suffered a rare dual loss on Thursday, just their second loss of the season, as they fell to a strong (and deep) Moorhead team 110-73. “Going against Moorhead brought some great competition to the Pirate athletes last night,” head coach Marley Melbye said. “It’s good for the girls to swim against athletes that they are unfamiliar with and that bring stiff competition for the Pirates.” The Spuds have a swim roster that goes 56 deep, something that threw the Pirates off a bit at first. “We came out of the gate a little slow yesterday,” Melbye said. “The girls started out a little intimidated looking across the pool and seeing 56 black and orange suits.” However, the Pirates hung in there, and had a strong night grabbing four first place, four second place, and five third place finishes in the 12 events. As per usual, the Pirate relays were among their strongest results, finishing first in the 200 and 400 M Freestyle relays, taking second in the 200 Medley relay and third in the aforementioned 400 M Freestyle relay. “The 400 Freestyle Relay in the last couple of meets has been the Pirates’ strongest of relays,” Melbye said. “They really showed strengths with both the A and B teams finishing towards the top.” Melbye also highlighted the 200 IM as a strong event for Crookston. “Both Thea Oman and Elizabeth Erdman represented the Pirates Swim Team extremely well,” Melbye said. “They are both swimming really well and every time they start a race it is anyone’s race.” In fact, there were several performances that Melbye highlighted on a night in which the Pirate coach was quite pleased with how the team stepped up to the challenge of the Spuds. “Sierra Pry had a great 500 swim, cutting nearly 10 seconds,” Melbye said. “She came bound and determined to achieve her goal and really tackled the 20 length of the pool.” Melbye also went on to note more about Erdman’s performance on Thursday. “Elizabeth had an extraordinary meet last night, “ Melbye said. “She had two personal bests in both her 200 Individuals Medley and the 100 Butterfly. Elizabeth is extremely dedicated to swimming and in her career will go far.” The Pirates have a week off before hosting the conference meet at the Crookston Community Pool next Friday.
